intro: Alangium villosum subsp. warburgianum, commonly known as the hairy alangium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a hairy texture. The fruit is a small, berry-like structure that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
